1017. In such cases of affliction where Satan has control of the mind, before engaging in prayer there should be the closest self-examination to discover if 
                                                                           237
there are not sins which need to be repented of, confessed, and forsaken. Deep humility of soul before God is necessary, and firm, humble reliance upon the blood of Christ alone. Fasting and prayer will accomplish nothing while the heart is estranged from God by a wrong course of action.--T., V. II, p. 146.
